Class.name: Net.MQTT.Agent
Class.Description:
The MQTT Agent is always started by a Net.MQTT.Client in the background to manage the real communication with the broker.

The agent inherits its settings from the Client, which started it and it is responsible for:

  • Building the TCP connection to the broker.
  • Executing the tasks created by the Client (and the Agent itself) based on the Net.MQTT.Aux.TaskList records. E.g.: sending various messages to the broker.
  • Keeping the connection alive by sending PING requests to the broker, when no other messages has been sent for a certain amount of time.
  • Listening for incoming messages from the broker and triggering appropriate actions based on the message type.

Method.name: StartListening
Method.Description:
This method is called directly (as a background job) by the Net.MQTT.Client to start the Agent.

pInitialState is the XML serialized content of the calling Client object, from which the agent can populate its own properties.

pUsername and pPassword are the optional credentials to be sent to the broker on connecting.

The Agent builds the TCP connection to the broker, sends a CONNECT message and then starts to communicate with the broker.

Method.name: Listen
Method.Description:
The main function of the Agent. Unless a fatal error happens, it runs in an endless loop, doing onw of the followin things in every loop:
  • If a pending Net.MQTT.Aux.TaskList object can be found for the Agent's unique connectionId, it starts to execute the corresponding task, then signals the initiator of the task via the %SYSTEM.Event API.
  • If no response has arrived from the broker for the last PING request within the KeepAliveInterval it treats the connection to the broker broken and stops.
  • If no other messages has been sent to the broker for a certain amount of time (~ 80% of the ) KeepAliveInterval, it sends a PING request to keep the connection alive.
  • Listens for incoming messages.

Method.name: RecvMessage
Method.Description:
Listens for incoming messages.

First takes a 1 byte MQTT Header. The takes the following 1 to 4 bytes to define the remaining length of the message. Finally reads the remaining part of the message and triggers appropriate action based on the message type (extracted from the Header).

Method.name: DoCONNECT
Method.Description: Builds the TCP connection to the MQTT broker and sends the CONNECT message.

Method.name: DoDISCONNECT
Method.Description: Sends a DISCONNECT message to the MQTT broker and closes the TCP connection.
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..SendDISCONNECT() Do ..CloseDev() Use ..saveIODev
Quit tSC

Method.name: DoSUBSCRIBE
Method.Description:
Sends a SUBSCRIBE message to the MQTT broker.

The ContextId of the corresponding Net.MQTT.Aux.TaskList object is a Message Idenifier. If it contains a colon, this is a repeated attempt, because no acknowledge has been received from the broker within the defined timout period.

The details of the SUBSCRIBE message must be stored in a Net.MQTT.Aux.Subscription object.
Method.Implementation:
Set dup = 0 Set msgid = pMessageId If $Length(pMessageId, ":") > 1 { Set msgid = $Piece(pMessageId, ":", 1) Set dup = (''$Piece(pMessageId, ":", 2)) } Set topics = ##class(Net.MQTT.Aux.Subscription).GetTopicList(..ClientId, msgid, .tSC) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ..SendSUBSCRIBE(msgid, topics, dup)
Quit tSC

Method.name: DoUNSUBSCRIBE
Method.Description:
Sends a UNSUBSCRIBE message to the MQTT broker.

The ContextId of the corresponding Net.MQTT.Aux.TaskList object is a Message Idenifier. If it contains a colon, this is a repeated attempt, because no acknowledge has been received from the broker within the defined timout period.

The details of the UNSUBSCRIBE message must be stored in a Net.MQTT.Aux.Subscription object.
Method.Implementation:
Set dup = 0 Set msgid = pMessageId If $Length(pMessageId, ":") > 1 { Set msgid = $Piece(pMessageId, ":", 1) Set dup = (''$Piece(pMessageId, ":", 2)) } Set topics = ##class(Net.MQTT.Aux.Subscription).GetTopicList(..ClientId, msgid, .tSC) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ..SendUNSUBSCRIBE(msgid, topics, dup)
Quit tSC

Method.name: DoPUBLISH
Method.Description:
Sends a PUBLISH message to the MQTT broker.

The ContextId of the corresponding Net.MQTT.Aux.TaskList object is a Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStore object ID. If it contains a colon, this is a repeated attempt, because no acknowledge has been received from the broker within the defined timout period.

The details of the PUBLISH message are stored in the referenced Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStore object.

On QoS levels > 0 it also pushes the Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStatus to the next state (either waiting for a PUBACK or PUBREC message).

Method.name: DoPUBACK
Method.Description:
Sends a PUBACK message to the MQTT broker for an incoming, QoS Level 1 message.

The ContextId of the corresponding Net.MQTT.Aux.TaskList object is a Message Identifier.

This is the end of the message flow of the incoming message.
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..SendPUBACK(pMessageId) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStatus).DoneMessageIn(..ClientId, pMessageId)
Quit tSC

Method.name: DoPUBREC
Method.Description:
Sends a PUBREC message to the MQTT broker for an incoming, QoS Level 2 message.

The ContextId of the corresponding Net.MQTT.Aux.TaskList object is a Message Identifier.

It also pushes the Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStatus to the next state (waiting for a PUBREL message).
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..SendPUBREC(pMessageId) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStatus).ReleaseMessageIn(..ClientId, pMessageId)
Quit tSC

Method.name: DoPUBREL
Method.Description:
Sends a PUBREL message to the MQTT broker for an outgoing, QoS Level 2 message.

The ContextId of the corresponding Net.MQTT.Aux.TaskList object is a Message Identifier. If it contains a colon, this is a repeated attempt, because no acknowledge has been received for the original PUBLISH message from the broker within the defined timout period.

It also pushes the Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStatus to the next state (waiting for a PUBCOMP message).
Method.Implementation:
Set dup = 0 Set msgid = pMessageId If $Length(pMessageId, ":") > 1 { Set msgid = $Piece(pMessageId, ":", 1) Set dup = (''$Piece(pMessageId, ":", 2)) } Set tSC = ..SendPUBREL(msgid, dup) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStatus).CompleteMessageOut(..ClientId, pMessageId)
Quit tSC

Method.name: DoPUBCOMP
Method.Description:
Sends a PUBCOMP message to the MQTT broker for an incoming, QoS Level 2 message.

The ContextId of the corresponding Net.MQTT.Aux.TaskList object is a Message Identifier.

This is the end of the message flow of the incoming message.
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..SendPUBCOMP(pMessageId) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStatus).DoneMessageIn(..ClientId, pMessageId)
Quit tSC

Method.name: SendCONNECT
Method.Description: Creates the variable header and payload of a CONNECT message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.

Method.name: SendDISCONNECT
Method.Description: Creates a DISCONNECT message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation: Quit ..PackSendMsg("", $$$MQTTDISCONNECT)

Method.name: SendPINGREQ
Method.Description: Creates a PINGREQ message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg("", $$$MQTTPINGREQ) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) ..lastPing = $ZDateTime($ZTimeStamp, 3, 1)
Quit tSC

Method.name: SendSUBSCRIBE
Method.Description: Creates the variable header and payload of a SUBSCRIBE message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:
#dim topic As Net.MQTT.Message
Set varhdr = $$$MQTTEncodeNumber(+pMessageId)
Set payload = "", key = "" While 1 { Set topic = pTopics.GetNext(.key) Quit:(key = "") Set payload = payload _ ..GetUTFString(topic.Topic) _ $Char($Case(topic.QoSLevel, 2: $$$MQTTSubQoS2, 1: $$$MQTTSubQoS1, : 0)) }
Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg(varhdr_payload, $$$MQTTSUBSCRIBE, pDup, 1) Quit tSC

Method.name: SendUNSUBSCRIBE
Method.Description: Creates the variable header and payload of an UNSUBSCRIBE message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:
#dim topic As Net.MQTT.Message
Set varhdr = $$$MQTTEncodeNumber(+pMessageId)
Set payload = "", key = "" While 1 { Set topic = pTopics.GetNext(.key) Quit:(key = "") Set payload = payload _ ..GetUTFString(topic.Topic) }
Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg(varhdr_payload, $$$MQTTUNSUBSCRIBE, pDup, 1) Quit tSC

Method.name: SendPUBLISH
Method.Description: Creates the variable header and payload of a PUBLISH message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:
Set varhdr = ..GetUTFString(pMessage.Topic) _ $Select(pMessage.QoSLevel > 0: $$$MQTTEncodeNumber(+pMessage.MessageId), 1: "")
Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg(varhdr_pMessage.Content, $$$MQTTPUBLISH, pDup, pMessage.QoSLevel, pMessage.Retain) Quit tSC

Method.name: SendPUBACK
Method.Description: Creates the variable header of a PUBACK message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:
Set varhdr = $$$MQTTEncodeNumber(+pMessageId)
Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg(varhdr, $$$MQTTPUBACK) Quit tSC

Method.name: SendPUBREC
Method.Description: Creates the variable header of a PUBREC message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:
Set varhdr = $$$MQTTEncodeNumber(+pMessageId)
Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg(varhdr, $$$MQTTPUBREC) Quit tSC

Method.Description: Creates the variable header of a PUBREL message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:

Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg(varhdr, $$$MQTTPUBREL, pDup, 1) Quit tSC

Method.Description: Creates the variable header of a PUBCOMP message and sends the package to the MQTT broker.
Method.Implementation:
Set varhdr = $$$MQTTEncodeNumber(+pMessageId)
Set tSC = ..PackSendMsg(varhdr, $$$MQTTPUBCOMP) Quit tSC

Method.name: RecvCONNACK
Method.Description: Evaluates a CONNACK message, received from the MQTT Broker and signals the initiator (Net.MQTT.Client) via the %SYSTEM.Event API about the success or failure of the connection attempt.

Method.name: RecvPINGRESP
Method.Description: Evaluates a PINGRESP message, received from the MQTT Broker and clears the lastPing property, so the Agent can know that the broker is still responsive and the connection is successfully kept alive.

Method.name: RecvUNSUBACK
Method.Description: Evaluates an UNSUBACK message, received from the MQTT Broker and signals the Net.MQTT.Client waiting for this acknowledge of a previously sent UNSUBSCRIBE message.
Method.Implementation: ..RecvAcknowledge("UNSUBACK", pDup, pQoS, pRetain, pContent)

Method.name: RecvPUBACK
Method.Description:
Evaluates a PUBACK message, received from the MQTT Broker and signals the Net.MQTT.Client waiting for this acknowledge of a previously published QoS Level 1 message.

This is the end of the message flow of the outgoing message.
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..RecvAcknowledge("PUBACK", pDup, pQoS, pRetain, pContent, .msgid) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStatus).DoneMessageOut(..ClientId, msgid)
Quit tSC

Method.name: RecvPUBREC
Method.Description:
Evaluates a PUBREC message, received from the MQTT Broker and signals the Net.MQTT.Client waiting for this acknowledge of a previously published QoS Level 2 message.

It also pushes the Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStatus to the next state (a PUBREL message has to be sent).
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..RecvAcknowledge("PUBREC", pDup, pQoS, pRetain, pContent, .msgid) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStatus).ReleaseMessageOut(..ClientId, msgid)
Quit tSC

Method.name: RecvPUBREL
Method.Description:
Evaluates a PUBREL message, received from the MQTT Broker.

It pushes the Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStatus to the next state (a PUBCOMP message has to be sent), and cretes a new task (Net.MQTT.Aux.TaskList) to complete the next step of the QoS Level 2 message flow.
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..RecvAcknowledge("PUBREL", pDup, pQoS, pRetain, pContent, .msgid) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStatus).CompleteMessageIn(..ClientId, msgid) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) taskid = ##class(Net.MQTT.Aux.TaskList).CreateNewTask(..connectionId, msgid, "PUBCOMP", .tSC)
Quit tSC

Method.name: RecvPUBCOMP
Method.Description:
Evaluates a PUBCOMP message, received from the MQTT Broker and signals the Net.MQTT.Client waiting for this acknowledge of a previously published QoS Level 2 message.

This is the end of the message flow of the outgoing message.
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = ..RecvAcknowledge("PUBCOMP", pDup, pQoS, pRetain, pContent, .msgid) Set:$$$ISOK(tSC) tSC = ##class(Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStatus).DoneMessageOut(..ClientId, msgid)
Quit tSC

Method.name: RecvAcknowledge
Method.Description: Generic method for evaluating an acknowledge type message and signaling the appropriate process via the <class>%SYSTEM.Event</class> API waiting for this acknowledge.

Method.name: RecvSUBACK
Method.Description: Evaluates a SUBACK message, received from the MQTT Broker, stores the QoS levels granted by the broker on the various items of the subscription message (see: Net.MQTT.Aux.Subscription) and signals the Net.MQTT.Client waiting for this acknowledge of the previously sent SUBSCRIBE message.

Method.name: RecvPUBLISH
Method.Description:
Evaluates a PUBLISH message, received from the MQTT Broker and stores the incoming message as a Net.MQTT.MessageStore object.

If the QoS Level > 0, it also pushes the Net.MQTT.Aux.MessageStatus to the next state (either a PUBACK or PUBREC message has to be sent), and cretes a new task (Net.MQTT.Aux.TaskList) to complete the next step of the message flow.

Method.name: CloseDev
PackSendMsg
Method.Implementation:
Set header = $Char(pMessageType + $Select(pDup: $$$MQTTDup, 1: 0) + $Select(pRetain: $$$MQTTRetain, 1: 0) + $Case(pQoS, 2: $$$MQTTQoS2, 1: $$$MQTTQoS1, : 0) )
Set lng = $Length(pMessage) While 1 { Set nxt = lng # 128 Set lng = lng \ 128 If lng > 0 { Set nxt = nxt + 128 } Set header = header _ $Char(nxt) Quit:(lng '> 0) }
Set msg = header_pMessage Write msg, ! Set ..lastMessage = $ZDateTime($ZTimeStamp, 3, 1) $$$MQTTTraceOUT($$$MQTTMsgType(pMessageType), msg)
Quit $$$OK

Method.name: GetMessageType
IsDuplicate
Method.Implementation: Set a = $Factor($Ascii(pHeader)) Set b = $Factor($$$MQTTDup) Quit $BitLogic(a & b) = b

Method.name: GetQoSLevel
Method.Implementation: Set a = $Factor($Ascii(pHeader)) Set q1 = $Factor($$$MQTTQoS1) Set q2 = $Factor($$$MQTTQoS2) Quit $Select($BitLogic(a & q2) = q2: 2, $BitLogic(a & q1) = q1: 1, 1: 0)

Method.name: IsRetain
Method.Implementation: Set a = $Factor($Ascii(pHeader)) Set b = $Factor($$$MQTTRetain) Quit $BitLogic(a & b) = b

Method.name: GetUTFString
Method.Implementation:
Set tString = $ZCVT(pString, "O", ..transTable) Set tLen = $L(tString)
Quit $$$MQTTEncodeNumber(tLen) _ tString
